description.en: The course consists of lectures and seminars connected to Estonia and Estonians. The courses and seminars offer several possibilities to compare Estonia with other countries, especially the ones where exchange students are from. During the course, students will get to discover Estonia and also share their personal experiences in Estonia. (The most important problems of Estonian culture are analyzed both in historical perspective as well as in relation to contemporary developments. The main stages in the development of Estonian culture, important persons. The relations of Estonian folklore, customs and beliefs with contemporaray Estonian society. Modern Estonian culture, media and culture, cultural establishments)
description.et: Kursus koosneb loengutest ja seminaridest, mille jooksul arutletakse Eesti maa, looduse, ajaloo, kultuuri, elanike, ühiskonna ja traditsioonide üle ning võrreldakse Eestit nende riikidega, kust on pärit kursusel osalevad üliõpilased. Kursuse jooksul avastavad üliõpilased Eestit ja jagavad teistega Eestis kogetut.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce Estonia (state, nature, history, people, society and culture) to the foreign students of Viljandi Culture academy. The course participations will compare and discuss the similarities and differences between Estonia and their homelands and discuss their perceptions and personal experiences in Estonia. Support students in achieveing the basic knowledge of Estonian culture and ability to interact in Estonian cultural enviroment
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on tutvustada välisüliõpilastele Eestit, meie loodust, ajalugu, rahvast, ühiskonda ja kultuuri. Kursuse vältel võrreldakse Eesti ja oma kodumaa sarnaseid ja erinevaid jooni ning väljendatakse oma ootusi siin veedetud aja ja Eestis kogetu kohta ning toetada võimekust iseseisvalt mõista Eestis käibel olevate kommete, uskumuste ja käitumismallide päritolu ja näha nende seoseid eesti kultuuriloo erinevate ilmingutega.

learning_outcomes.en: During the semester the exchange student acquires preliminary knowledge of Estonia, Estonians and Estonian culture and society, by participating in lectures, attending seminars and completing different written and/or oral tasks. The capability to cope in Estonian cultural enviroment and to understand basic cultural processes.
learning_outcomes.et: Semestri jooksul omandab välisüliõpilane loenguid kuulates, seminaridel osaledes ja ülesandeid täites algteadmised Eestist, eestlastest, Eesti kultuurist ja ühiskonnast

notes.et:
The lectures take place in Viljandi Culture Academy.
First meeting takes place 13.02.2024.

independent_work.et: The course is based on readings and discussions.

grade_preconditions.et:
There is no final exam or test of the course.
In order to pass the course, a student has to:
-Participate in more than 50% of the classes
-Take part in the seminars and visits
-essay/oral assesment

grade_evaluation.et: The student passes the course if he/she assists to more than 50% of the classes, actively participates in the discussions and gets a positive sum of points in two written papers.

debt_elimination.et: Will be agreed individually if there is a sound reason for that.

resources.mandatory_materials: The lecturer introduces in the first lecture of the semester.
resources.recommended_materials:
Recommended literature:
Petrone, J., My Estonia 1, Petrone Print
Petrone, J., (2009)  My Estonia 2, Petrone Print

description.et:
Introduction. Course evaluation and recommended literature.
Culture, culture shock and coping strategies. Republic of Estonia - general data.
Introduction video and its analysis. Estonian national symbols. Flag days.
History of Estonia II. National Awakening and Estonia as a Republic (a historical walk around Viljandi).
Independent fieldwork: visit to Viljandi Museum.
Estonian culture through cinema: a film screening.
Film screening and analysis. A glimpse into Estonian folk calendar.
Estonian nature: a trip to the bog.
Estonian cuisine: cooking lunch together. Our Estonia Trivia.

audience.et: English B2.The subject does not require any specific knowledge. The course is intended for students of Viljandi Culture Academy.
